conclusion: The shadows are currently cast in front of the objects, indicating that the light source is positioned above and slightly in front of the objects.
A is the shadow of a piece of paper, B is the shadow of a lamp, C is the shadow of a ring, and D is the shadow of an avocado.
When the light source moves to the back left above the objects, the shadows will shift in the direction opposite to the light source's movement.
A (Paper): The shadow will move to the right and slightly towards the bottom.
B (Lamp): The shadow will also move to the right and slightly downward.
C (Ring): This shadow will shift to the right and slightly downward.
D (Avocado): The shadow will move to the right and slightly downward.
Shadows are cast in the direction opposite to the incoming light. As the light moves to the back left, shadows will naturally shift toward the front right.
When the light source moves to the back left above the objects, shadows A, B, C, and D will all shift to the right and slightly downward.
